meta.name: title
meta.content: Placer Union HSD: Innovative High School Education in the Sierra Foothills
Placer Union HSD: Innovative High School Education in the Sierra Foothills
Placer Union HSD: Innovative High School Education in the Sierra Foothills

meta.name: description
meta.content: We invite you to visit our high schools and district office, discovering for yourself why Placer Union High School District is in the vanguard of innovative California school districts. Talented students and their families, along with supportive communities and a dedicated staff and school board all factor into the equation for student success in the high school years and beyond. Welcome to Placer Union High School District.

We invite you to visit our high schools and district office, discovering for yourself why Placer Union High School District is in the vanguard of innovative California school districts. Talented students and their families, along with supportive communities and a dedicated staff and school board all factor into the equation for student success in the high school years and beyond. Welcome to Placer Union High School District.

We invite you to visit our high schools and district office, discovering for yourself why Placer Union High School District is in the vanguard of innovative California school districts. Talented students and their families, along with supportive communities and a dedicated staff and school board all factor into the equation for student success in the high school years and beyond. Welcome to Placer Union High School District.

link.title: Placer Union HSD: Innovative High School Education in the Sierra Foothills

div.span: Committed to student learning through teaching excellence in a supportive environment.

iframe.title: Slideshow All Rights Reserved Kirksville Web Design 2012

div.span: We invite you to visit our high schools and district campus, discovering for yourself why Placer Union is in the vanguard of innovative California school districts. Talented students and their families, along with supportive communities and a dedicated staff and school board all factor into the equation for student success during the high school years and beyond.

font.span:
Our high school communities are nestled in the
Northern California Sierra Foothills, east of Sacramento.

span.font: All PUHSD schools are closed for in-person student attendance. Students and teachers are participating in distance learning, which will continue through the end of the school year.

div.p: PUHSD has adopted new district graduation requirements. Visit our page to learn more.

div.br: The PUHSD Board of Trustees welcomes student representatives in an advisory capacity to its bi-monthly meetings. The "student voice" is critical to governance conversations as the district continues forward with student-centered initiatives and outcomes.

div.p: Pursuant to Ed Code 52060 on or before July 1, 2019, the Governing Board of each school district shall adopt a Local Control & Accountability Plan (LCAP) and Maidu Virtual Charter Academy Local Control & Accountability Plan (MVCA LCAP) using the template adopted by the State Board of Education. Visit our LCAP webpage for more details.

div.span: PUHSD staff and faculty are committed to a professional code of conduct that is articulated in two documents:
. And in alignment with the code of conduct, Placer Union is committed as an equal opportunity organization.

If your family does not have access to WiFi during this time of distance learning, we want to hear from you. Call 530.886.4440 and let us know your situation so we can recommend a solution. You may qualify for a district-provided hotspot for the duration of distance learning and limited campus access during Placer County's shelter-in-place.

div.div: If you are making a necessary trip near a PUHSD high school, students are welcome to synch their chromebook to the cloud by connecting to our open public WiFi. Also, a network-enabled Mid-Placer bus is parked adjacent to the Alta Community Center for students residing in the neighborhoods of Alta and Dutch Flat. Review this “how-to” to set Gmail to work offline: tutorial. And Wave is offering a low cost solution for families that qualify, please see their Internet First Flyer.

font.span: cannot consistently access WiFi via family, friend, library or local business during Placer County's shelter-in-place directive, please contact 530.886.4440 or fill out our

div.span: We are committed to finding you a solution.

div.font: Learn about what's happening in Placer Union.

span.a: Measure D - Del Oro High School

span.div: Placer Union's Board of Trustees holds public meetings throughout the school year, including periodic joint meetings with local pre-K-8 districts and Sierra Community College. View their agendas online or visit their webpage for meeting dates and profiles on these five dedicated public servants.

a.title: Did you know? That anyone even young, healthy adults can get sick from the flu and spread it to others. Buzz buzz (text message: You coming out tonight? I can't I have the flu. My niece and girlfriend have it now too.) The short time it will take you to get a flu vaccine. Can help protect you and the ones you love. The flu vaccine is safe and does not cause the flu. #FightFlu
